marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia expected to cut BI Rate by 25 bps to 4.5% on 22 Oct 2025
marketNews.content: Economists expect Bank Indonesia to cut the BI Rate by 25 basis points to 4.5% in the upcoming board meeting on Wednesday (22/10), according to a Reuters survey. The expectation is based on the central bank’s likely emphasis on supporting economic growth despite a weakening rupiah. Last month, the central bank unexpectedly cut the BI Rate by 25 bps, reflecting an “all-out pro-growth” stance alongside expansive fiscal policy. Economists also project the BI Rate to fall to 4.25% by the end of 2025 and stay at that level through 2026.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo sets 40 million target for free nutritious meals program
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto said on Monday (20/10) that the National Nutrition Agency targets 40 million people to receive free nutritious meals, although he does not want to force the target. The agency had projected 70 million beneficiaries by the end of 2025, about 15 % below the original 83 million target. The president ordered the agency to set strict procedures and noted that food-poisoning incidents are unacceptable.

marketNews.title: Trump says extra China tariff is unsustainable and looks forward to APEC meeting
marketNews.content: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday (17/10) that his previous threat of an additional 100-percentage-point tariff on China was “not sustainable”. He also confirmed a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping at the APEC summit in South Korea on 31 Oct-1 Nov 2025.

marketNews.title: Gold prices dip 1.73 % to $4,251.82 as Trump’s tariff warning weighs on safe-haven demand
marketNews.content: Spot gold fell 1.73 % to $4,251.82 per troy ounce on Friday (17/10), the biggest daily drop since May 2025, after Trump’s tariff comment. On Monday (20/10) gold was flat, edging up to about $4,264 per ounce. Bloomberg reported that markets are now focused on the upcoming U.S.–China talks, with expectations that a deal could reduce safe-haven demand for gold.

marketNews.title: China’s 3Q25 GDP growth slows to 4.8 % YoY
marketNews.content: China’s economy grew 4.8 % YoY in 3Q25 (down from 5.2 % YoY in 2Q25), matching consensus but marking the slowest pace since 3Q24. The 9-month total reached 5.2 % YoY, above the government’s 5 % target for 2025.

marketNews.title: Asaki projects 8 % YoY rise in 9M25 ceramic production
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association (Asaki) estimates 9M25 ceramic production will grow about +8 % YoY to 330-335 million m², with utilization rising to roughly 72 % (vs. 63 % in 2024). Challenges include sub-optimal use of certain natural gas, raw-material supply constraints, and a sharp rise in imports from Malaysia, Vietnam and India, which the association suspects are unfair-trade and trans-shipment from China.

marketNews.title: Metropolitan Land posts 1.35 trillion IDR marketing sales in 9M25
marketNews.content: Metropolitan Land reported 9M25 marketing sales of about IDR 1.35 trillion (+4.3 % YoY), reaching roughly 67 % of the 2025 target of IDR 2 trillion.

marketNews.title: GZCO denies any talks with PT Energi Melayani Negeri over share acquisition
marketNews.content: Gozco Plantations clarified to the IDX that there has been no communication, discussion or official contact with PT Energi Melayani Negeri – a company linked to the spouse of the House Speaker – regarding a proposed share acquisition. The clarification follows an Emitennews report that the state-linked firm would take about half of GZCO’s shares.

tickerNews.title: BBCA reports 9M25 net profit of IDR 43.4 trillion (+6 % YoY) and announces up to IDR 5 trillion buyback
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) recorded net profit of IDR 14.4 trillion in 3Q25 (+1 % YoY, –3 % QoQ). The result brings 9M25 net profit to IDR 43.4 trillion (+6 % YoY), matching the 75 % consensus for 2025F (vs. 75 % actual in 9M24). The company remained cautious in credit disbursement and raised provisions, yet management is optimistic for 4Q25 and 2026 as macro conditions improve with higher government spending and falling rates. Guidance for 2025 credit growth is kept at +6-8 % YoY, with September 2025 already at +8 % YoY. Cost of Credit is expected to be 0.5 % at year-end, lower than the 0.6 % level in 3Q25, supported by a quarterly NPL decline after two quarters of increase. Management sees 2026 credit growth possibly +8-10 % as loan-yield pressure eases. The bank may cut the policy rate once in 2025 and three times in 2026. A buy-back of up to IDR 5 trillion is planned for 22 Oct 2025-19 Jan 2026 at a maximum price of IDR 9,200 per share, subject to market conditions. Dividend payout discussion is ongoing; the payout ratio could rise from 67.4 % (2024) given a CAR of 29.9 % as of September 2025.

tickerNews.title: ASSA posts 9M25 net profit up 64 % YoY
tickerNews.content: Adi Sarana Armada (ASSA) posted a net profit of IDR 143 billion in 3Q25 (+70 % YoY, +39 % QoQ), bringing 9M25 net profit to IDR 349 billion (+64 % YoY). The increase was driven by solid revenue growth (+24 % YoY in 3Q25, +21 % YoY in 9M25) and margin expansion, with operating profit up +42 % YoY in 3Q25 and +49 % YoY in 9M25, especially from the logistics-service segment (+46 % YoY in 3Q25, +39 % YoY in 9M25).

tickerNews.title: PTBA reports 9M25 coal production of 35.9 million tonnes
tickerNews.content: PT Bukit Asam (PTBA) reported coal production of 35.9 million tonnes in 9M25 (+8.9 % YoY), about 72 % of the 2025 target of 50 million tonnes. Sales reached 33.7 million tonnes (+7.7 % YoY), about 67 % of the target. Domestic sales accounted for 56 % of total, the rest exported. The company plans a downstream DME project next year, reserving 800 million tonnes for the venture; the first DME plant would need roughly US$2.5 billion (≈ IDR 40 trillion).

tickerNews.title: ADMR stake increase by parent ADRO to 85.02 %
tickerNews.content: Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO) bought 231 million ADMR shares at an average price of IDR 1,435 per share on 16 Oct 2025, valuing the transaction at roughly IDR 331.5 billion. ADRO’s direct stake in ADMR rose from about 84.45 % to 85.02 %.

tickerNews.title: BUVA sells 710 million shares for IDR 579 billion
tickerNews.content: Bukit Uluwatu Villa (BUVA) sold approximately 710 million shares on 15 Oct 2025 at an average price of IDR 815 per share, raising about IDR 579 billion to realise investment gains and rebalance the portfolio. The founder’s ownership fell from 3.99 % to 0.54 %.

tickerNews.title: ACES reports 9M25 same-store-sales contraction of 3.6 % YoY
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) recorded same-store-sales growth (SSSG) of –8.2 % YoY in September 2025 (vs. –4.1 % in August 2025, +8.8 % in September 2024). The 9M25 SSSG contracted 3.6 % YoY (vs. +9.8 % YoY in 9M24), missing the 2025 target of > +1 % YoY. All regions posted declines: non-Java –1.7 % YoY, Java outside Jakarta –4.6 % YoY, Jakarta –4.7 % YoY.

tickerNews.title: BREN starts first geothermal exploration well in Hamding, North Maluku
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewables Energy, through its subsidiary PT Star Energy Geothermal Indonesia, began drilling its first exploration well in Hamding, North Maluku. The project targets 50 MW of installed capacity out of a 300 MW development plan, with an estimated geothermal resource of 275-550 MW.

tickerNews.title: LPKR to acquire 100 % of PT Karya Sentra Sejahtera
tickerNews.content: Lippo Karawaci, via PT Abadi Jaya Sakti and PT Tigamitra Ekamulia, signed an agreement to acquire 100 % of PT Karya Sentra Sejahtera from a non-affiliated party. The transaction is valued at IDR 332.2 billion before adjustments for debt and capex commitments. PT Karya Sentra Sejahtera owns the Imperial Aryaduta Hotel & Country Club, a 5-star hotel in Lippo Karawaci, Tangerang.

tickerNews.title: CDIA CEO purchases 600 k shares at IDR 1,989 each
tickerNews.content: Chandra Daya Investasi’s CEO Fransiskus Ruly Aryawan bought 600,000 CDIA shares at an average price of IDR 1,989, totaling about IDR 1.2 billion. His direct ownership rose from 0.004 % to 0.0045 %.

tickerNews.title: DVLA announces IDR 45.9 billion interim dividend for FY 2025
tickerNews.content: Darya-Varia Laboratoria plans to distribute an interim dividend for FY 2025 of about IDR 45.9 billion (IDR 41 per share), implying a 2.5 % dividend yield as of Monday (20/10). The dividend is payable on 29 Oct 2025 in the regular market and on 17 Nov 2025 in the negotiation market.
